page.title: 04FARMING IN CHELFORD cont.
page.content: Most of their produce is used by the David Lewis Centre which owns the farm. Little Moss Farm has 80 dairy cattle and 520 poultry. They grow barley, grass and swedes for the animals and corn and potatoes as well. Roadside farm has 100 dairy cows and 90 sheep. They grow barley and potatoes. Heawood Hall farm just grows corn because less labour is needed. Eight of our farms have under 100 acres of land and so according to one farmer are actually small holdings not farms. Only three of the farms have any workers living on the farm. They all send their produce to Chelford market because it is so near. They all use quite a lot of machinery and all the farmers work long hours.
